definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: likeness, similitude (mostly late) (acc. to Lag:BN 12. 147 ff. mispunct. for [[דִּמְוַת]] fr. [[דִּמְוׇה]]; acc. to We:Prol. 413. Eng. Tr. 389 an Aram. Loan-word, but v. Di Ge 5:l, Dr:JPh xi. 216 Che:OP. 474)—abs. ´[[ד]] Is 40:18 + 3 t.; cstr. ´[[ד]] Ge 5:1 + 16 t.; sf. [[דְּמוּתוֹ]] Ge 5:3; [[דְּמוּתֵנוּ]] Ge 1:26; —

likeness, similitude, of external appearance, chiefly in Ezek.: Ez Eze 1:5 (likeness, i.e. something that appeared like) so v:Eze 1:26, Eze 8:2 ([[אֵשׁ]])[[דְּמוּת כְּמַרְאֵה ]] (cf. Co), Eze 10:1 [[כִּסֵּא]] ´[[כְּמַרְאֵה ד]]; cf. also Da 10:16 [[כִּדְמוּת בְּנֵי אָדָם]] i.e. one like the sons of man; similitude, resemblance Ez Eze 1:5, Eze 1:10, Eze 1:16, Eze 1:22, Eze 1:26, Eze 10:10, Eze 10:21, Eze 10:22; [[דְּמוּת כְּמַרְאֵה אָדָם]] Eze 1:26; ´[[מַרְאֵה ד]] ´[[כְּבוֹד י]] v:Eze 1:28; also 2Ki 16:10 (pattern of altar), 2Ch 4:3 (images of oxen); of son in likeness of father Ge 5:3 (P); so also of man in likeness of God Ge 1:26 (‖[[חֶלֶם]]) Ge 5:1 (both P); cf. Is 40:18 what ´[[ד]] will ye compare to him ([[אֵל]]) ? ‖[[דִּמָּה]] q.v.

adverbially, in likeness of, like as Is 13:4 cf. Ez Eze 23:15 & ´[[כִּד]] Ps 58:5.—Ez Eze 1:13 rd. [[וּבֵינוֹת]], v. [[בֵּין]] and J P Peters:JBL 1892 40. 42. On [[דְּמוּת אֶחָד]] Ez Eze 1:16, Eze 10:10 (apparently masc.) cf. Thes & Sm who trans. the likeness of one had they all four; Co rds. [[אחת]].
